Package.Name: MIGS.vi.miscellaneous.6.0
Package.Description: Use for virus genomic sequences. Organism must have lineage Viruses.
Package.TemplateHeader: # This is a submission template for batch deposit of 'MIGS: virus, miscellaneous; version 6.0' samples to the NCBI BioSample database (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/). # See SAMN02412548 for an example record of this type of BioSample (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN02412548). # Fields with an asterisk (*) are mandatory. Your submission will fail if any mandatory fields are not completed. If information is unavailable for any mandatory field, please enter 'not collected', 'not applicable' or 'missing' as appropriate. # All other fields are optional. Leave optional fields empty if no information is available. # You can add any number of custom fields to fully describe your BioSamples, simply include them in the table. # CAUTION: Be aware that Excel may automatically apply formatting to your data. In particular, take care with dates, incrementing autofills and special characters like / or -. Doublecheck that your text file is accurate before uploading to BioSample. # TO MAKE A SUBMISSION: # 1. Complete the template table (typically in Excel, or another spreadsheet application) # 2. Save the worksheet as a Text (Tab-delimited) file - use 'File, Save as, Save as type: Text (Tab-delimited)' # 3. Upload the file on the 'Attributes' tab of the BioSample Submission Portal at https://submit.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/subs/biosample/. # 4. If you have any questions, please contact us at biosamplehelp@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov.

Attribute.Name: strain
Attribute.Description: microbial or eukaryotic strain name

Attribute.Name: isolate
Attribute.Description: identification or description of the specific individual from which this sample was obtained

Attribute.Name: collection date
Attribute.Description: the date on which the sample was collected; date/time ranges are supported by providing two dates from among the supported value formats, delimited by a forward-slash character; collection times are supported by adding "T", then the hour and minute after the date, and must be in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), otherwise known as "Zulu Time" (Z); supported formats include "DD-Mmm-YYYY", "Mmm-YYYY", "YYYY" or ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-mm-dd", "YYYY-mm", "YYYY-mm-ddThh:mm:ss"; e.g., 30-Oct-1990, Oct-1990, 1990, 1990-10-30, 1990-10, 21-Oct-1952/15-Feb-1953, 2015-10-11T17:53:03Z; valid non-ISO dates will be automatically transformed to ISO format

Attribute.Name: broad-scale environmental context
Attribute.Description: Add terms that identify the major environment type(s) where your sample was collected. Recommend subclasses of biome [ENVO:00000428]. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes e.g.: Â mangrove biome [ENVO:01000181]|estuarine biome [ENVO:01000020]

Attribute.Name: local-scale environmental context
Attribute.Description: Add terms that identify environmental entities having causal influences upon the entity at time of sampling, multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g.: Â shoreline [ENVO:00000486]|intertidal zone [ENVO:00000316]

Attribute.Name: environmental medium
Attribute.Description: Add terms that identify the material displaced by the entity at time of sampling. Recommend subclasses of environmental material [ENVO:00010483]. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes e.g.: estuarine water [ENVO:01000301]|estuarine mud [ENVO:00002160]

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from this list http://www.insdc.org/documents/country-qualifier-vocabulary. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Canada: Vancouver" or "Germany: halfway down Zugspitze, Alps"

Attribute.Name: isolation and growth condition
Attribute.Description: PMID or url for isolation and growth condition specifications

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.Description: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 38.98 N 77.11 W

Attribute.Name: propagation
Attribute.Description: phage: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic; plasmid: incompatibility group; eukaryote: asexual/sexual

Attribute.Name: alkalinity
Attribute.Description: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

Attribute.Name: altitude
Attribute.Description: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

Attribute.Name: ammonium
Attribute.Description: concentration of ammonium

Attribute.Name: biomass
Attribute.Description: amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. microbial, total. can include multiple measurements

Attribute.Name: observed biotic relationship
Attribute.Description: Free-living or from host (define relationship)

Attribute.Name: bromide
Attribute.Description: concentration of bromide

Attribute.Name: calcium
Attribute.Description: concentration of calcium

Attribute.Name: chemical administration
Attribute.Description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

Attribute.Name: chloride
Attribute.Description: concentration of chloride

Attribute.Name: chlorophyll
Attribute.Description: concentration of chlorophyll

Attribute.Name: collection method
Attribute.Description: Process used to collect the sample, e.g., bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL)

Attribute.Name: density
Attribute.Description: density of sample

Attribute.Name: depth
Attribute.Description: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectivly. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

Attribute.Name: diether lipids
Attribute.Description: concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

Attribute.Name: dissolved carbon dioxide
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide

Attribute.Name: dissolved hydrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved hydrogen

Attribute.Name: dissolved inorganic carbon
Attribute.Description: dissolved inorganic carbon concentration

Attribute.Name: dissolved organic nitrogen
Attribute.Description: dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

Attribute.Name: dissolved oxygen
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved oxygen

Attribute.Name: elevation
Attribute.Description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

Attribute.Name: encoded traits
Attribute.Description: Traits like antibiotic resistance/xenobiotic degration phenotypes/converting phage genes

Attribute.Name: estimated size
Attribute.Description: Estimated size of genome

Attribute.Name: host
Attribute.Description: The natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which the sample was obtained. Use the full taxonomic name, eg, "Homo sapiens".

Attribute.Name: host disease
Attribute.Description: Name of relevant disease, e.g. Salmonella gastroenteritis. Controlled vocabulary, http://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/1009 or http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/mesh

Attribute.Name: host taxonomy ID
Attribute.Description: NCBI taxonomy ID of the host, e.g. 9606

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.

Attribute.Name: miscellaneous parameter
Attribute.Description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.Name: negative control type
Attribute.Description: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation, e.g., distilled water, phosphate buffer, empty collection device, empty collection tube, DNA-free PCR mix, sterile swab, sterile syringe

Attribute.Name: nitrate
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrate

Attribute.Name: nitrite
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrite

Attribute.Name: nitrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrogen (total)

Attribute.Name: number of replicons
Attribute.Description: Number of replicons in nuclear genome

Attribute.Name: Omics Observatory ID
Attribute.Description: A unique identifier of the omics-enabled observatory (or comparable time series) your data derives from. This identifier should be provided by the OMICON ontology; if you require a new identifier for your time series, contact the ontology's developers. Information is available here:Â https://github.com/GLOMICON/omicon. This field is only applicable to records which derive from an omics time-series or observatory.

Attribute.Name: organic carbon
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic carbon

Attribute.Name: organic matter
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic matter

Attribute.Name: organic nitrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic nitrogen

Attribute.Name: organism count
Attribute.Description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

Attribute.Name: oxygenation status of sample
Attribute.Description: oxygenation status of sample

Attribute.Name: pathogenicity
Attribute.Description: To what is the entity pathogenic

Attribute.Name: perturbation
Attribute.Description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

Attribute.Name: pH
Attribute.Description: pH measurement

Attribute.Name: phosphate
Attribute.Description: concentration of phosphate

Attribute.Name: phospholipid fatty acid
Attribute.Description: concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

Attribute.Name: positive control type
Attribute.Description: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive

Attribute.Name: potassium
Attribute.Description: concentration of potassium

Attribute.Name: pressure
Attribute.Description: pressure to which the sample is subject, in atmospheres

Attribute.Name: reference for biomaterial
Attribute.Description: Primary publication or genome report

Attribute.Name: salinity
Attribute.Description: salinity measurement

Attribute.Name: sample collection device or method
Attribute.Description: Method or device employed for collecting sample

Attribute.Name: sample material processing
Attribute.Description: Processing applied to the sample during or after isolation

Attribute.Name: sample size
Attribute.Description: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.Description: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: silicate
Attribute.Description: concentration of silicate

Attribute.Name: sodium
Attribute.Description: sodium concentration

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.Description: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples.

Attribute.Name: subspecific genetic lineage
Attribute.Description: Information about the genetic distinctness of the lineage (eg., biovar, serovar)

Attribute.Name: sulfate
Attribute.Description: concentration of sulfate

Attribute.Name: sulfide
Attribute.Description: concentration of sulfide

Attribute.Name: temperature
Attribute.Description: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: water current
Attribute.Description: measurement of magnitude and direction of flow within a fluid
